title: 108_s2764
content: The "Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2004" extends the Terrorism Risk Insurance Program until 2007. The Secretary retains authority over issues related to this program. Conforming amendments are also made. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2004 extends the program until 2007, with definitions for Program Years 4 and 5 added. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include provisions for insured losses occurring before December 31, 2007, and conforming amendments are made to the Act. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to adjust insurer deductibles for Program Years and make conforming amendments to the Act. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to adjust insurer deductibles for Program Years and make conforming amendments to the Act, including changes to the duration of policies and mandatory availability. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to adjust insurer deductibles for Program Years and make conforming amendments to the Act, including changes to the duration of policies and mandatory availability. Insured losses under a policy issued during Program Year 5 must remain in effect for at least 1 year after issuance, with exceptions for losses occurring after the policy expiration date or December 31, 2008. Amendments are made to insured loss shared compensation provisions. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to adjust insurer deductibles for Program Years 4 and 5, with specific aggregate retention amounts set for each year. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to adjust insurer deductibles for Program Years 4 and 5, with specific aggregate retention amounts set for each year, including the aggregate amount of insured losses during such Program Year. SEC. 4. COVERAGE OF GROUP LIFE INSURANCE. Section 103 of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include provisions for the applicability of the act to providers of group life insurance. The Secretary will determine the appropriate application of the provisions to group life insurance providers, consistent with the purposes of the act. The rules will aim to apply the provisions to group life insurance providers in a similar manner as they apply to insurers under the act. Considerations will be made in determining the applicability of the act to group life insurance providers. The Secretary will issue final regulations within 90 days of the enactment of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2004 to apply the provisions of the act to providers of group life insurance. The term 'group life insurance' refers to insurance contracts that offer term life insurance coverage and accidental death benefits. Group life insurance provides coverage for multiple individuals under one contract, offering term life insurance and accidental death benefits. Recommendations for long-term solutions regarding the availability and affordability of insurance for terrorism risk must be submitted to Congress by the Presidential Working Group on Financial Markets by June 30, 2006.
